Package functions

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • functions.Function
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Function
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class representing a function f(x) with FunctionParts

    For Example:
    • Funktion.functionParts[Sin(4), PowerFunction(3,4), ExponentialFunction(2,5)]

    toString:
    • "4sin(x)+ 3x4+ 2*5x

    Features:
    • build derivative
    • build antiderivative
    • calculate extreme points, turning points & more
    • calculate function value
    • calculate zeros (see newtonMethod(Interval, double, Function))
    • calculate rotation volume
    • calculate surface under the curve
    • calculate mean
    • calculate arc length

    All costy methods do have an Thread.interrupt() check implemented
    This check stops the operation and sets the interrupt flag again.
    Version:
    2.0 ..
    Author:
    Jonathan Brose, Nick Dressler
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • variableName

        private java.lang.String variableName
        variable Name used to calculate the function Z.B.: x -> f(x)= 2*x -1

      • functionName

        private java.lang.String functionName
        Name of the function funktionsName(x) = ...
        For example: funktionsName = "f" -> f(x)= ...

      • functionParts

        private java.util.ArrayList<FunctionPart> functionParts
        Stores the FunctionParts of the function.

      • step

        private double step
        Step in which calculateExtremePoints(Interval), calculateMaximumPoints(Interval), calculateSaddlePoints(Interval), calculateMinimumPoints(Interval) and newtonMethod(Interval, double, Function) iterate trough the function values. If step is to great it can happen that a extreme point or a zero is not recognized
        Normally the predefined value works fine.

      • epsilon

        private double epsilon
        The tolerance of all calculations.
        A smaller Tolerance is better, but it takes a lot longer to calculate.
        See Also:
        newtonMethod(Interval, double, Function), calculateArcLength(Interval), calculateDistance(double, double), calculateUppersum(Interval)

        public Function getAntiderivative()

        Returns:

        the Y-offset C always is 0!
        if the function is to complex returns null.

      • calculateSliceMultiplier

        private int calculateSliceMultiplier​(double difference)

        This increases speed.
        Parameters:
        difference - difference between the last and newest result.
        Returns:
        multiplier for increasing the sliceCount

      • newtonMethod

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> newtonMethod​(Interval interval,
                                                           double epsilon,
                                                           Function function)
        Calculates the zeros with the newton Method

        can be stopped trough Thread.interrupt()
        Parameters:
        interval - Ist der Intervall, in dem nach Nullstellen gesucht wird.
        epsilon - Epsilon-Wert, bestimmt Genauigkeit.
        function - Die zu untersuchende Function.
        Returns:
        Gibt ArrayList mit Double-Werten (Stellen) zurück.
